results.title: Escape from Sobibor
results.creator_credit: Dennis E. Doty, Rule-Starger Productions, Zenith Productions and Jack Gold
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Richard Rashke, and unpublished manuscripts From the ashes of Sobibor” by Thomas Blatt and “Inferno in Sobibor by Stanislaw Szmajzner, this made for television (originally as a miniseries) drama tells the true story of a heroic escape by Jewish prisoners in the Nazi death camp in the forests of Sobibor, a Polish village, in October 1943. During the camp’s operation from May 1942 to October 1943, approximately 250,000 Polish and Russian Jews were exterminated in the five gas chambers - only the skilled survived to work as labourers under the watchful and often brutal Nazi guards. But even those who did survive knew they were on borrowed time. Escape was the only answer. The traumatised prisoners, led by Leon Feldhendler (Alan Arkin) along with the support of the prisoners of war Russian soldiers under the command of Alexander Percherski (Rutger Hauer), hatch a fantastic plan of escape. However, this ambitious plan is not just for a handful of prisoners, it is a chance for all 600 prisoners to make a bid for freedom and survival. This uprising proved to be the largest and most successful of its kind during World War II. For forty years the world was unaware of the events - the Nazis destroyed the camp and all of its records in a cover-up by burning it to the ground. An intense human drama displaying some of the brutality, but also the determination, spirit and courage of those who survived the Holocaust and this most amazing escape. Cast also includes Joanna Pacula, Hartmut Becker, Simon Gregor and Jack Shepherd.

results.title: Entr'acte
results.brief_description: A humorous cinematic poem attempting to capture all the images and associations of carnival, which dissolve into each other in the dreams of a young man who has just returned from an evening at the fair. There is no plot, each image suggesting the one to follow. This is one of the most celebrated of French avant-garde films. Made originally for a ballet called “Relache” (i.e. performance suspended) it was thus a joke within a joke - an entr’acte or intermission in a non-existent performance. No spoken word, this film’s story was written by Francis Picabia with music by Erik Satie

results.title: Edvard Munch
results.creator_credit: Peter Watkins, Sveriges Radio and Norsk Rikskringkasting
results.brief_description: Watkin’s portrayal of the life and work of the pioneer Norwegian expressionist painter and graphic artist Edvard Munch (1863-1908), combines quasi-documentary and period drama, incorporating meticulous detail to place the artist in a social and historical context. The use of non-professional actors, often communicating directly with the audience by glances into the camera, adds to the immediacy of the dialogue which was written in collaboration with the cast. The resulting film takes the viewer to the heart of the artistic temperament and to the very core of the creative process. In Norwegian and German dialogue with English narration and subtitles. Cast includes Geir Westby and Gro Fraas.

results.title: Educating Rita
results.creator_credit: Lewis Gilbert, Acorn Films and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the play of the same name by Willy Russell. Frank, a cynical and drunken professor of literature is appalled and then amused by the quest for knowledge and culture of one of his new students, a hairdresser named Rita. Frank soon finds that Rita has more zest for life and more natural intelligence than most of his “educated students”. Features Michael Caine and Julie Walters.

results.title: Ed Wood
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Denise Di Novi and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Tim Burton pays homage to a Hollywood visionary in this unusual, fictionalised biography of the world’s worst director, Edward D. Wood Jr. The film follows Wood in his quest for film greatness as he writes and directs turkey after turkey, cross-dresses, and surrounds himself with a motley crew of Hollywood misfits, outcasts, has-beens and never-weres. The real story however, is his friendship with ageing, morphine-addicted Bela Lugosi, for whom he tries to stage a comeback. Cast includes: Johnny Depp, Martin Landau, Sarah Jessica Parker, Patricia Arquette, Bill Murray, Jeffrey Jones and Lisa Marie.

results.title: Eat the rich
results.creator_credit: Peter Richardson, Tim Van Rellim and Ironfist Pictures
results.brief_description: From the makers of the “Comic strip” and the “Young Ones”, this black and often tasteless comedy is certain to startle. Alex, a black waiter at a celebrated restaurant for the rich called “Bastards”, is sacked. Determined to wreak revenge, he organises a people’s take over and captures the restaurant. Renaming it “Eat the Rich”, Alex and his friends serve up their own special brand of millionaires mince. Not for the faint-hearted and with a heavy metal soundtrack by Motorhead.

results.title: East is east
results.creator_credit: Damien O'Donnell, Leslee Udwin, Assassin Films and Film Four International
results.brief_description: Set in a small town in the north of England in 1971 this comedy/drama focuses on the inter-generational and cross-cultural conflicts in a large Anglo-Pakistani family. Patriarch George Kahn’s attempts to instill traditional Pakistani values in his seven young adult children are constantly thwarted— both by his easy going British wife and the siblings’ own ambitions. In their claustrophobically cramped terrace house, anarchy erupts daily with farcical energy. The film takes a more serious turn when Kahn decides to set up arranged marriages for his eldest sons. The fierce resistance he faces from his children and their deep resentment at the fact that he has never acknowledged the reality of their lives force him to confront his own chauvinist nature. Cast includes Om Puri and Linda Bassett.

results.title: Duran Duran
results.creator_credit: Educational Media International and Russell Mulcahy
results.brief_description: A collection of Duran Duran first eleven videotapes. Two of the clips “Girls on film” and “Chauffeur” contain material which would have a theatrical “M” rating. Adult preview recommended.

results.title: Dough and dynamite
results.creator_credit: Mack Sennett, Keystone Film Company and Charles Chaplin
results.brief_description: A Charlie Chaplin comedy concerning labor trouble in a bakehouse. Slapstick comedy at its best. Cast includes Chester Conklin, Charley Chase, Edgar Kennedy, Slim Summerville.

results.title: Doctor De Soto
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel, Weston Woods Studios and Michael Sporn
results.brief_description: Doctor De Soto, a mouse dentist, refuses to treat animals “dangerous” to mice, until one day a fox shows up writhing in pain from a toothache. How Doctor De Soto and his assistant, Mrs. De Soto “outfox the fox” is a humorous story.
